distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
Updated X.org packages that fix a security issue are now available for Red
Hat Enterprise Linux 4.

This update has been rated as having important security impact by the Red
Hat Security Response Team.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
X.org is an open source implementation of the X Window System. It provides
the basic low-level functionality that full-fledged graphical user
interfaces are designed upon.

An integer overflow flaw in the way the X.org server processes PCF files
was discovered. A malicious authorized client could exploit this issue to
cause a denial of service (crash) or potentially execute arbitrary code
with root privileges on the X.org server. (CVE-2006-3467)

Users of X.org should upgrade to these updated packages, which contain a
backported patch and is not vulnerable to this issue.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: This content is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). If you distribute this content, or a modified version of it, you must provide attribution to Red Hat Inc. and provide a link to the original.
notes.title: Terms of Use

notes.text: Integer overflow in FreeType before 2.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted PCF file, as demonstrated by the Red Hat bad1.pcf test file, due to a partial fix of CVE-2006-1861.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: freetype: integer overflow vulnerability due to incomplete fix for CVE-2006-1861
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 is not vulnerable to this issue as it contains a backported patch.
notes.title: Statement

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  To use Red Hat Network,
launch the Red Hat Update Agent with the following command:

up2date

This will start an interactive process that will result in the appropriate
RPMs being upgraded on your system.

vulnerabilities.title: freetype: integer overflow vulnerability due to incomplete fix for CVE-2006-1861
